Blog.post: Aloha and welcome. Please feel free to check back often as I share my various moments of the day.
Angola, Indiana - Speaking at Angola High School and Tri-State University. Great audiences and great day.

Indy - Taking Angelina and Anna to the doctor for the annual check up and hearing myself utter the words in true conversation, "try not to poopy in the cup." Also, taking them to Chuck E Cheese afterwards for funtime!

Indy - Celebrating my mom's 60th birthday party with the entire family. Had a wonderful day with her and also enjoyed visiting great aunt Mae in the hospital and taking her on a wheel chair ride. Finally, the Colts victory over the Saints was a big one...first time Colts ahve had a 4 and 0 season in 26 years. Go Colts!

Spent the night at the cabin in Brown County with Angelina's class...hiked in the rain all through the creek...had a campfire...and slept in tents in a thunderstorm. Doesn't get much better than that!
Home - Went to fly kites with Anna, Angelina and Buddy John at Broad Ripple Park. We even got the kite up in the air. It was a great afternoon!
Having a morning picnic out by the river with special B. It was wonderful to spend that time together. Also, meeting up with Dese, Meg, Danny, T Bayt and Brandon at Starbucks, to reconnect!
Las Vegas, Nevada - Went to see the show "O" for the third time in my life and once again found it astounding. One of my top 10 life experiences!

Las Vegas, Nevada - Spent the day with my mom and her 9 or so closest friends along with a few friends of moy own...celebrating my 36th birthday and my mom turning 60. The MOTD probably had to be sitting down with a psychic for the first time in my life. Real wild and real profound!

Speaking at Estero High School in Florida near Fort Myers. Making a new friend, Dr. Jones, who works in the parking lot of the school. Wonderful audiences. Full of energy and very supportive administration. Spent the rest of the day with Micki (my mom) on jet skis in the ocean...until we tipped over. Don't ask. Found a great sushi and thai restaurant. Great day.
Indy - Happy Halloween! Taking the girls trick or treating and going to the black tie event for the Damien Center at the Indiana Roof Ballroom. Great night where they raised over $100,000!

Wisconsin Dells - Spoke at a local leadership conference and had a blast. Then spent the rest of the day with the family enjoying yet more water slides at Treasure Island! This has been a wet and wonderful visit!

Wisconsin Dells - Too many MOTD. Being at the Kalahari Resort with Anna, Angelina and Brandon is a blast. THis is the coolest water park in the world with amazing indoor water slides. You have to see it to believe it.
Indy - Spoke in Avon, Indiana and Selma, Indiana today and had a blast at both schools. But, my moment of the day was seeing Anna and Angelina again and spending the evening with them!
INDY - Colts WIN against the Houston Texans...great day with a group of friends from Paradigm...went to see Tim Conway and Harvey Corman in concert. Very interesting!
Indy - Had a wonderful evening with Brandon's parents in Cloverdale...followed by dinner with Vince and his new girlfriend Lori, T Bayt, Desi, the Dream, Danny and Stephanie! Great night!
Indy - Back home again in Indiana! yeah! Great day at the Bernardsvlle 8th Grade Youth Summitt and an even better night at Paradigm. Great to reconnect with everyone again.
New Jersey - Spoke at Radix and Holly Glenn Elementary Schools and had an absolute blast. Great students and amazing adults who have a true passion for education and students...and it shows!
Verona, NJ - Spoke at Verona High School and enjoyed my chat with Johnny, Tommy, Vanessa, Alex, Alyssa, Carine and Pam. They were a fun group and it was a great school.

Troy, MO - Spent the day in Troy speaking to the National Honor Society and a group of 5th graders. Tonight, there were hundreds that showed up for an evening program. Great day all around. Great town.
Monday - Indy - Brandon and I spent the day with Karl and Jeanne Anthony and had a great time just being.
Indy - Spent the day with Karl and Jeanne Anthony and debuted the Choose To Love song at the Garden! Yeah!

Indy - Going to Anna's school carnival...carving pumpkins with Anna and Angelina...and spending time with my dear friends Karl and Jeanne Anthony as we sat by the fire with Jim, Meg and Brandon and sang, laughed and talked. Great night! Great life!
WInchester VA - Spoke at Handley High School for their Homecoming and was able to be part of one of the best Homecoming celebrations I have ever experienced in a high school. Amazing!
Indy - Spent a great morning with Mikey Smith having breakfast at Patachou and catching up. Made it safely to Winchester, VA and am excited about a great day tomorrow.
Indy - Going to the pumpkin patch with Brandon, Mikey Smith, Anna and Angelina. It was great and we found the perfect pumpkins.
Casper, WY - Had a great day at the Healthy Communities Conference in Wyoming speaking to young people and adults. My MOTD was spending coffee time with Ty Sells.
Casper, WY - Spending the day with Ty Sells at a state leadership conference.
Indy - Going to the Colts game and spending the day with an amazing group of people. Okay, so we lost in overtime by three...superbowl, here we still come!
Indy - Celebrating Brandon's and Brandi's 25th birthday in Cloverdale with their entire family.
Hannibal, MO and Indy - Spoke at a teacher inservice today and had a ton of fun. But my moment of the day was climbing trees and riding bikes with Anna and Angelina back at home.

Hannibal, MO - I was in Java Jive coffee house today and watched a group of kids on a field trip come in wanting to buy Hot Chocolate. There were about 8 boys. Not everyone could afford the hot chocolate. A man, unrelated to the group, stepped up to the counter and bought drinks for all the boys. They were dumbfounded and thankful. It was a great moment.

Hannibal, MO - I am in the home town of Mark Twain and The Unsinkable Molly Brown who was on the Titanic. I spoke today to the middle school, high school and then tonight to a group of parents. Overall, a very good day. The schools were amazing with great auditoriums - which makes all the difference. Today's visit was sponsored by the C.H.A.R.T. Teen Task Force. Great day.
Indy and Hannibal, MO - Spent the day with Brandon celebrating his 25th birthday. It was a great day and I am so happy to have been home to be with him all day!
Indy - Watching the COLTS beat Tampa Bay, in overtime, on a Monday Night Game. One of the greatest football games I have ever seen. Superbowl, here we come!
indy - Participated I a rope course today and was able to jump from the top of a thirty foot telephone pole in to the air to catch a flag. It was insane and fun.
Indianapolis - Rejoining my group of friends tonight from the the group I am in, Vision in Action. We had a great night being together and laughing and watching the movie Defending Your Life.

Missouri and Indianapolis - Speaking at an excellent STUDCO Conference in Missouri. Then tonight we went to visit great Aunt Mae in her new home. She is doing much beter after being inn the hospital. Thank God!
The new website is LIVE! Yeah!!!

Indy - Saw a great movie last night with friends, Shattered Glass. VERY GOOD. Afterwards, we all headed back to my house to start the Holiday Season off. Tonight was great as well all went to Meg's for Turkey Day leftovers and to enjoy each others company. Great night all around!

Indy - Cooked a gret Thanksgiving Dinner for Grandma, Mom, Dad, Brandon, Katie, Bill, Anna and Angelina. It was a lot of fun. So much to be thankful about. Last night we also saw the movie ELF which was hilarious.
Indy - Picked up Grandma from the airport as she is i town for thanksgiving! I am so thankful for my family!
Indy - Spent the entire weekend with my friends, fixing up the house that belongs to the Indiana Youth Group. It was a TON of work but was well worth it. I am totally exhausted and ready to rest!!!

Indianapolis - Spoke in New Jersey today at Thomas Jefferson Middle School where some of the students had shirts made with my face on them. Hilarious. Tonight, the paradigm group met up at the Indiana Youth Group to plan our community service weekend. I can't wait!
New Jersey - Spoke in Woodcliff and Westwood and had a blast. In Woodcliff, I spoke to a middle school and in Westwood, I returned to the high school to work with student leaders.

Columbus, Ohio - Spoke at most of the Catholic High Schools today and had a great time. Each school was amazing in it's own way and I am so blessed to have had the chance to be part of sharing the ALOHA spirit. What a great time. Thanks Columbus!
Indy - Celebrating Angelina's birthday at her school. Happy 8th year pajamalina!
Indy - Colts win over the Jets, 38-31. Great game and great day with friends at the dome!
Yesterday - Angelina's 8th birthday party was a blast. The theme was Scooby Doo. It was a wonderful way to begin her ninth year on this planet!

Pennsylvania - Spoke at the state student council convention today and had a blast on their leader-ship. Also, I was able to reconnect with an old friend, Mike Smith...a great speaker from California. Wonderful day with amazing lei-ders.

Chicago Area - Spoke at Gross Middle School and Hauser Junior High Schools. Both were great schools with students, staff and auditoriums that were amazing. I am so proud to have been able to share the ALOHA spirit with them!
Last Night (Sunday) - Went to see Dame Edna at the Murat Temple with my mom, Brandon and my friend Jim Zarvos. She was absolutely hilarious!
Indy - Great day at home! Getting stuff done, spending time with the girls, having taco night. Enjoying the day!!!
North Carolina - Today, I spoke at the state student council convention here in NC. The entire conference theme is ALOHA and the student leaders here went overboard. This is an amazing conference.
Bloomington - Tonight, Brandon and I had dinner with my amazing Aunts Melanie and Susan. They are so wonderful and I am so blessed to have them. Great night!!
Spoke at the Willow Tree Conference. It is one of the sigle best middle shool preventin camps I have ever seen. It is always a blessing to invited to be there!
New Jersey - Spoke at Slocum Skews School and Cresskill High School...and had a blast at both. Great schools, great audiences and amazing teachers. What a great day.

West Des Moines, Iowa - Spoke for the Dekko Foundation where I overheard a lady named Suzie who inspired me to take my bowl of light story to a whole new level. The Dekko Foundation inspires young people to make a difference in the world. They are amazing!
Indy - Last night, I celebrated my mothers life as she finished her Level One of Paradigm. It was great to spend the time with her and share a moment!
Brown County - A couple of days in the middle of the woods on a great winter day!
Indy - Watching the Colts beat the Texans to clinch the division! Yeah!!!!
Indy - Enjoyed a wonderful Christmas with the entire family. Perfect.

Indy - Spending a great day with Anna and Angelina by seein the Cat in the Hat movie. Absolutely hilarious. Had a wonderful Christmas night with Chris, John John, Pastor steve, Grandma, Great Grandma, Dreifus, Anna, Angelina, Bill, Katie, Corky and Brandon. It was perfect.

Indy - Yesterday, went to Chicago with Katie, Brandon and Mom to see hairspray. it was hilarious and a to n of fun. Tonight, we went to the Colts game where they sadly lost to the Broncos. Great time, though.
Indy - Went to see Anna's Christmas Program at school where she sung Frosty the Snowman. It was, by far, the most interesting school program I have ever experienced.
INDY - Presented last night at the gueset night for Paradigm Discovery (www.TheIndianaCenter.com). It was a great turn out and a lot of fun to share my experience with others.

Indy - Just returned from Las Vegas for the last few days where I spent time with Ty Sells, Karl Anthony, Ray Lozano, Vic Perez, Nick Webb and Dave Myers. It was a ton of fun as we always enjoy our annual time together. I would write more, but what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas. Yesterday, my MOTD was experiencing friend Dave Wilcox in concert and meeting his ten year old son, Nathan. Today, the Colts were at home and confidently beat Atlanta. SUperbowl, here we come!
Las Vegas - Being here with my good friend Karl Anthony. We are here for business and pleasure...and last night we were able to get tickets for the Billboard Music Awards. It was a blast.
Indy - Had an amazing weekend with a group of friends from paradigm Discovery. It was a great time to share love and friendship with so many. VIA X Lives!
Indy - Spent a great day catching up with friends and with work. TBAYT and I hung out in a coffee house and enjoyed each other. Gret winter day in Indy.
Indy - Went to the Beef and Boards Christmas Show tonight with Brandon and the girls and had a great time. What a perfect way to start the holiday season!

Indy - Yesterday - Being at the Colts game, and although we lost, it was great to be with such an amazing group of people. I lost a bet to friend Ed Gerety since he picked the Patriots. Another motd was at church last night as we enjoyed being with Carolyn and attending an open discussion with Kent Millard about the upcoming Methodist Conference next year.
Houston - Great night at the NFL Comishiners Party held at the Astrodome. A blast dancing and having fun with the group.

Houston - Here for some football game on Sunday. My MOTD was playing Guesstures with Meg, Danny, Casey, Vijay, Dese, Christine, Kalen, T Bayt, Vince and Brandon. It was a blast. Also, givinng bull rides in the livinng room was kinda fun, too.

Indy - Last night, dressed up as Tigger and went to give a singing telegram with Brandon and Dese for our 45 year old friend for life, Danny. He was at a really swank restaurant and it was really funny.

Cape Haze, Florida - It has been some time since I last wrote, but I am here in Florida visiting my pledge brother from college, Matt White. In January of 1999, Matt was diagnosed with ALS, also known as Lou Gehrig's disease. Although it is a terminal disease, Matt has shown me how one can live through adversity and get the most life out of living. After all, Matt chooses to live until the moment he dies. And even then, he lives. Spending time here is a blessing.
Indy - Spoke in Southern INdiana today to two great middle schools. It was a blast.
Indy - Spent the day, yesterday, staffing an amazing conference here in Indy. It is a great way to connect with others and give back.
Indy - Colts Win in Kansas City! New England, here we come!
Indy - Introducing the girls to the puppy and celebrating John John's Birthday with Chris and Brandon at a show called TUNA TEXAS. It was hilarious!

West Palm Beach, Florida - Had a great time speaking at the County Student Council conference to all the high schools in Palm Beach County. Enjoyed the ocean views, seafood and WARM weather! Can't wait to get home to see Crazy Maesy the puppy!
West Palm Beach, Florida - Saw my friend Chris George in the national tour of KISS ME KATE. He did a great job and it was wonderful to experience him in the show and have dinner afterwards.
Indy - Celebrated the life of Great Aunt Mae at her funeral and welcomed a new life into our world with a Jack Russell puppy named Maesy. Life is beautiful!

Indy - A great day celebrating the life of the girls father, Jose, who passed away a week ago. We had a memorial service for him which was wonderful. Anna and Angelina have taught me a lot about death and the celebration it should be.
Indy - A great night of relaxation and friends with Christine, Dese, Danny, Meg, TBayt, and Brandon. A great way to ring in the new year!
Indy - Finding a brand new private super duper secret playground with Anna and Angelina. Playing outside in February is never a bad thing!
East Dreenwich, Rhode Island - Having lunch with my good friend Bob Houghtaling and then speaking at his amazing school Cole Junior High. Great day.
Indy - The annual pancake and jazz dinner at Church to ring in lent. Dancing with Anna and Angelina was definitely the highlight.
Indy - Having lunch with one of my favorite speakers, Melanie Mills. It was great to reconnect with her in such a wonderful way. It was a great time together.
Chicago - Visiting my best and amazing friend, Judy McHargue, who is up from Texas. We had a great night doing nothing but laughing and catching up. It was a true gift!

North Carolina - Spoke at three schools today. South Rowan, East Rowan and Irwin Middle School. I don't know where to begin. ERHS and Irwin were in their auditorium and it was an amazing group. Tons of energy and respect. I really appreciated being there and felt appreciated. At SRHS, they went way out of their way to decorate the gym for the day and to celebrate ALOHA in the halls and with the students. Although sound systems in gyms can be nuts, the audience really endured and hung in there and I really am thankful. There is something about North Carolina that I really like. Thanks for the hospitality.

North Carolina - Spoke at Alexander High School today and was totally impressed with the tradition and respect of the student body. They really went the extra mile to make the assembly the best it could be. I had a great time with a school of about 1,700. I also enjoyed just driving through this state. Absolutely beautiful.
Bloomington, IN - Seeing the musical SEUSSICAL with my Aunt Sue, Aunt Mel and Brandon. It was aweseome!
Bloomington, IN - Seeing the musical SEUSSICAL with my Aunt Sue, Aunt Mel and Brandon. It was aweseome!
Indy - Had the annual Valentine's Day celebration with a great group of friends. Amazing family.
Indy - Happy Friday the 13th. Wonderful day at home, trying not to freeze to death as the floors were being refinished. Long story. Great day.
Indy - Enjoying a wonderful walk with my sister, Maisy and Mattie...until Mattie ran away for a while.
Indy - Presented once again at a guest open house for Paradigm Discovery. (www.TheIndianaCenter.com) It was a great night and am thankful I had the opportunity to give back.
Brown County - Spent a great weekend in the woods with FIVE DOGS, Gray and Brandon. Snow everywhere. A wonderful couple of days.
Indy - Had a great day with the new canine addition to our family. Went to Christine and Dese's to watch the Superbowl commercials on TIVO. Hilarious.

Houston and Indy - So many moments. COming home from Houston after an amazing Superbowl experience. Also, picking up Maisy's brother, Mattie, as a new addition to our family. Four dogs. Does that make us crazy?
Houston - Fun night, last night, at dinner with the group before the big SUPER day today. Also, got to see my friend Rob who is here from New York for the game.

Glendale, Wisconsin - I spoke in Nicolet High School today where I presented five times before noon. It was a bit nuts, but a lot of fun. Each grade had a ton of energy and working with the student leaders was rewarding. Tonight, I spoke with the parents and enjoyed the evening. Great time in Wisconsin.

Indy - Wow...so many. Seeing my friend Dave Brown present his new book: The Self-Help Paradox...Going to celebrate with Dese, Christine and my Mom after paradigm...seeing my friend Spiffy after over a year...being with Dreifus. Too many to count. Great day.
Indy - Having dinner with my wonderful Aunt Kim, Special B and my mom. Kim signed up to be in Paradigm this May (www.theindianacenter.com). I am soooo excited for her. She will LOVE it!

New Jersey - This should be more of my moment of the week. I have been in Maryland and New Jersey all week long speaking at great schools and to wonderful parent groups. Today I spoke at the New Jersey State REBEL2 Conference for Middle Schoolers and had an absolute blast. I am exhausted and ready to head home!

Maryland - Finding out that my website is not gone after all. There was a weekend of panic as I think I did something to erase my site...but luckily, my pal Erik has everything backed up, so we should be up and running again within a day. Woo Hoo. I am in Maryland today speaking at South Carroll High School and then to a parent group tonight. Then I am off to New Jersey for the rest of the week.
Nevada, MO - Speaking in Nevada, Missouri to every kid from K through 12th grade. The middle school has ALOHA as their theme for the entire school year, so that was, by far, my moment of the day.
Indy - Had a great day at home with my MOTD with Dese, Special B, Mick and Katie...just being together and catching up.
Pennsylvania - Spoke at Pocono Mountain West High School today and had a great time. A beautiful school with a great group of students. I appreciated their respect and attitudes.

San Ramon, CA - Spoke at the area Youth to Youth conference for middle school leaders. An absolutely great conference of about 350 students and with a staff of about 100. This is their tenth anniversary of Youth to Youth. Congratulations.

San Ramon, CA - Spoke at a National Blue Ribbon School, Iron Horse Middle School. It was one of the top schools I have ever experienced. The principal, Kirby Hoy, was exceptional and his staff and students refelct that. I am so proud to have had the chance to be part of such a great school ohana.

Indy and San Fran - Made it home from Wisconsin, spent the night at home and then had a great session with Meg as she taught me some new stretches. It was really effective. Flew to Cally and am looking forward to the time out here.

Wisconsin - Spoke at Columbus Middle School, Lodi High School and Pardeeville High School. Each school was really great and respectful. It was a great day. I am now at the Kalahari Resort to speak in the area tomorrow. They have the worlds largest water park here, so there is fun to be had.
Indy - Celebrating my friend Megs 44th birthday with the family - Vince, T Bayt, Christine, Dese, Danny, Special B and ofcourse Meg. It was a great afternoon.
Indy - My two great friends Dese and Christine, had an engaging party tonight for Special B and myself. It was an amazing night with a great collection of friends and family.
Northern Indiana - Speaking at the Indiana Northern District Student Council Conference. They had an ALOHA theme and the group was a blast.
Indy - Going to the JCC for a great hour or so.

Indy - Spoke at Immaculate Heart of Mary school today to both the K through 4th grades and then the 5th through 8th. It was a great school and I was happy to be part of such a positive day. Plus, since this school is right down the street from where I live, it is nice to speak in your own back yard. Thanks IMH!
Indy - Spending the day in Cloverdale having lunch with Brandon's mom, seeing his Grandma and meeting about flowers for the big day in August. Great weather too for Indiana!

For example, two years ago i won the event with a statue of Jesus surrounded by onion rings for the movie: Lord of the Rings. You get the idea. This year, we had about 40 people with amazing ideas. Denver, CO - Spoke at three area high schools and had a great time in each one. The Cherry Creek School system is really great and I was also able to spend time with my good friend Coleen, so that was an added bonus!
Columbus, Ohio - Visting my good friends Ty and Angie Sells and spending time with their triplets Keegan, Tanner and Carly. They are angels.

Columbus, GA - Celebrating my thirteenth year at the annual "Drug Free You and Me" conference for all city sixth and seventh graders. My mom came with me here this week which will be a lot of fun. Great people and great cause.
Indy - Running a 15K race with my sister, Katie. She is doing amazing as she trains for the Indianapolis mini-marathon! Go Katie!

Southern Indiana - Spoke at four schools today, sponsored by Peers Educating Peers. They are a group of high school student leaders who work with younger students and encourage them to be abstinent. What an amazing group of people. I was so happy to be sponsored by them. Great day!
Jasper, Indiana - Wow. So many moments in the past few days. Going to Columbus, Ohio to see Josh Groban was amazing and speaking at Hilliard Darby High School was great.

Indy - Spending the day at friends Melanie and Sue along with Dese, Christine, Anna and Angelina. We dyed and created 400 Easter Baskets for underpriviledged children. Then tonight, going to the Good Friday service, was simply undescribable. What a blessing.

Indy - Enjoying Spring Break with my lovely little angels. Going to the park and the nature center, having picnics and of course, stripping wallpaper. Mmmm, nothing says spring break like stripping wallpaper!

Alabama - Spoke at Athens High School to all the county sophomores. It was sponsored by a group named T.R.A.I.L. who were an amazing group of young people who are focused on giving back to the world. My program was followed by a volunteer fair where students could get involved with a variety of organizations. It was a great idea and a great day.
Indy - Going to Chuck E Cheese with the girls, Judy Judy and Lucy Lou. Perfect.

Indy - Having my angelic friends Judy Judy and Lucy Love in town to visit from Texas. Lucy is 13 months old and is a gift from God. It is such a blesing to have a weekend with her and her amazing mother.

Detroit, MI - Spoke at one of the most amazing high schools - University of Detroit High School. A very smart, funny and quick audience that really enjoyed the message and made me feel quite at home. Great day.

Culver, Indiana - Sadly, it has been over a week since my last post, but I had a great week at home catching up on odds and ends. Today, I am up at the lake with Kalen and Meg enjoying the serenity. A great way to begin the summer. Right now, we are watching CAT IN THE HAT. Hilarious.

Indy - I also found out that two of my dearest friends, Ed and Suzanne Gerety are pregnant! I am so thankful that people like them are going to be parents as a gift to the rest of the world! They will be great parents.

Indy - Going dancing at the Vogue, here in Indianapolis, at a night called retro-rewind...where songs from the 80's are considered oldies. Okay, I am officially old. Danced with Queen B, Meg, Vince, Mark and countless others. Hilarious night.

Pennsylvania - How embarrassing. Blame it on my adhd, but a week without writing is sad. But, alas, I am back. My motd would have to be here in Pennsylvania and speaking at Downington High School West. It was to the juniors and seniors. They have a brand, spankin new school with a great auditorium and it was an all around great experience. I return tonight to speak to the student leader banquet. Great day.
Cleveland - Going to get Grandma and move her to her new home in INdianapolis. It will be so wonderful to have her in town!

Indianapolis - Having a great summer here in Indy. Getting ready for the big wedding in August...went to Holiday World with my nieces in Southern Indiana and had a BLAST...swimming at the JCC...spending time with my Grandma who recently moved to town...and trying to get things done before the fall. So far, so good.

Indy - Whoa! Where does the time go? Enjoying the beginning of summer...spending days in a cabin in southern Indiana...with great friends and four angelic canine beings. Oh, and did I mention the 50,000,000 secadas?

Brown County, Indiana - Spent two nights at the cabin, which was great. We had a ceremony for Corky, my dog of 14 years who passed away two weeks ago. We spread his ashes there, since that was his favorite place in the world.

Gainseville, Florida - Spoke last night at the state 4-H Congress to about 500 youth and 50 adults. It was an electrifying night. The confernece theme was "Riding the Waves of Success" and they had an ALOHA luau dance after my program. A ocean of fun.

July 26, 2004 - Whoa. It has been so long since I have last written here. I have really gotten caught up in the fun of summer. I will try to write a bit more before the school years gets rolling again. However, I do want to write about my experience I had over the weekend. In Noblesville, Indiana, there is a living museum called Conner Prarie Farm. It is all about life in 1886 when Grover Cleveland was president and the Governor of Indiana was Governor Gray. I had an opportunity to spend the entire weekend there, living as a charectar of 1886, with my two nieces Anna (a.k.a Christina Hancock) and Angelina (a.k.a. Mary Hancock) along with my sister Katie (a.k.a. Nancy Hancock.) My name was Salathiel Hartnet. It was an amazing time. We worked on the farms, made our meals from scratch, fed the pigs, split wood, and enjoyed evening activities without the benefit of running water or electricity. It was an experience of a lifetime that I am so happy to have shared with my beautiful angels. I wish everyone could experience life in 1886. Priceless. (And yes, at night if you had to use the 'privy', you instead had to use a 'chamber pot' which is NOT a pot you ever want to eat out of...if you know what I am saying.) Aloha.
Indy - The time is really flying by. Having a great summer and not taking the time to write each day since I am trying to avoid the computer as much as possible! Have a great, relaxing, aloha summer!
